docs.lead_paragraph: Ending a stormy five-year tenure marred by the disastrous rollout of President Obama’s signature legislative achievement, Kathleen Sebelius is resigning as secretary of Health and Human Services.

headline.main: Sebelius Resigns After Troubles Over Health Site
headline.print_headline: Sebelius Resigns After Troubles Over Health Site

docs.abstract: Health and Human Services Sec Kathleen Sebelius is resigning, ending stormy five-year tenure marred by disastrous rollout of Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act; Obama accepts her resignation and will nominate Office of Management and Budget Director Sylvia Mathews Burwell to replace her.
docs.snippet: Ending a stormy five-year tenure marred by the disastrous rollout of President Obama’s signature legislative achievement, Kathleen Sebelius is resigning as secretary of Health and Human Services.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, which was filed in federal court in Manhattan, is the latest in a string of challenges to the N.H.L.

headline.main: N.H.L. Promoted Violence Regardless of Health Risk, Players’ Suit Says
headline.print_headline: N.H.L. Promoted Violence Regardless of Health Risk, Players’ Suit Says

docs.abstract: Nine former professional hockey players file lawsuit against NHL, saying league 'intentionally created, fostered and promoted a culture of extreme violence'; suit, filed in federal court in Manhattan, is more graphic than others brought by former hockey players, highlighting the role of enforcers in the NHL over many years and mentioning movies that celebrate fighting in hockey.
docs.snippet: The lawsuit, which was filed in federal court in Manhattan, is the latest in a string of challenges to the N.H.L.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and KEN BELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: In March, the Treasury collected $216 billion in taxes, up 16 percent from a year ago, helping reduce the deficit for March to $37 billion.

headline.main: Tax Revenue Rockets Up, Helping Lessen the Deficit, Treasury Department Says
headline.print_headline: Tax Revenue Rockets Up, Helping Lessen the Deficit, Treasury Department Says

docs.abstract: Treasury Department reports surge in tax revenue and decline in spending; notes that federal budget deficit for first half of 2014 fiscal year totaled $413 billion, down $187 billion from where it stood at same period in 2013; rise points to rejuvenated upper class and recovering stock market.
docs.snippet: In March, the Treasury collected $216 billion in taxes, up 16 percent from a year ago, helping reduce the deficit for March to $37 billion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The blueprint, the fourth by Representative Paul D. Ryan, says it would bring the federal budget into balance by 2024 by, in part, cutting $5.1 trillion in spending over a decade.
docs.abstract: House approves nonbinding budget proposal by 219-to-205 vote; blueprint by Republican Rep Paul D Ryan cutting $5.1 trillion in spending over decade is seen as millstone by Democrats, but Republicans view it as a modest step.
docs.snippet: The blueprint, the fourth by Representative Paul D. Ryan, says it would bring the federal budget into balance by 2024 by, in part, cutting $5.1 trillion in spending over a decade.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Judges sparred with lawyers about how such bans affected the children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthened heterosexual unions.

headline.main: U.S. Court Seems Split on Utah Gay Marriage Ban
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Seems Split on Utah Marriage Ban

docs.abstract: Federal Court of Appeals for 10th Circuit appears divided about whether socially conservative state of Utah can ban same-sex marriage; judges spar with lawyers about how such bans affect children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthens heterosexual unions.
docs.snippet: Judges sparred with lawyers about how such bans affected the children of same-sex parents and whether preventing gay couples from marrying actually strengthened heterosexual unions.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is resigning after overseeing the botched rollout of President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law, a White House official said on Thursday.

headline.main: Health Secretary Resigns After Obamacare Launch Woes
headline.print_headline: Health Secretary Resigns After Obamacare Launch Woes

docs.snippet: U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is resigning after overseeing the botched rollout of President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law, a White House official said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials with Oregon's troubled health insurance exchange say they've narrowed the options for the site's future to two: switching to the federal exchange, or staying with the current technology and hiring a new contractor to fix it.

headline.main: Cover Oregon Narrows Exchange Future to 2 Options
headline.print_headline: Cover Oregon Narrows Exchange Future to 2 Options

docs.snippet: Officials with Oregon's troubled health insurance exchange say they've narrowed the options for the site's future to two: switching to the federal exchange, or staying with the current technology and hiring a new contractor to fix it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Embattled Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is resigning as the White House seeks to move past the election-year political damage inflicted by the rocky rollout of President Barack Obama's signature health care law.

headline.main: Sebelius Resigns After Health Care Rollout Fiasco
headline.print_headline: Sebelius Resigns After Health Care Rollout Fiasco

docs.snippet: Embattled Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is resigning as the White House seeks to move past the election-year political damage inflicted by the rocky rollout of President Barack Obama's signature health care law.
